about.title: About Us
about.subtitle: The African Diaspora Economic Council (ADEC) is an African Diaspora organization based in America dedicated to advocating and promoting the interests of the Africans Diaspora business entities throughout the United States

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: To advocate and promote bi-lateral trade, socioeconomic development and investment opportunities in the United States and the Emerging Markets of the Sub-Saharan African market region through collaboration with the United States business community, such as Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs), Multi-national Corporations and Non-Governmental Agencies (NGOs).

vision.title: Our Vision
vision.description: Our vision is to advocate and promote the interests of the Africans Diaspora business entities throughout the United States by collaborating with African Americans businesses, multi-national corporations, and individuals in positions of authority in the public sectors, for the sole purpose of advocating and promoting bilateral trade and socioeconomic development on both continents, especially as people of African descent faced uncertainty into the future.

values.title: Our Goals
values.subtitle: Establishing collaborative and strategic partnerships with the African Union (AU), the Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS) and the Common Markets of Eastern and Southeastern Africa (COMESA)

global.title: Revitalization
global.description: Developing a global model to rejuvenate economic activities across ECOWAS, COMESA, and all 55 African countries.

collaboration.title: Partnerships
collaboration.description: Strengthening existing alliances while forging new relationships to boost economic collaboration.

innovation.title: Expansion
innovation.description: Fostering business growth through procurement, capital access, and international trade under the African Growth Opportunity Act (AGOA).

excellence.title: Assistance
excellence.description: Providing technical support and guidance on accessing financial resources and infrastructure development.

impact.title: Development
impact.description: Creating an enabling environment for business retention, recruitment, capacity building, workforce development, and job creation.

integrity.title: Promotion
integrity.description: Enhancing Africaâ€™s business visibility through trade missions, exhibitions, seminars, and market development initiatives.

history.title: Our History
history.subtitle: Building bridges between Africa and its global diaspora to foster economic development, investment, and collaboration.

team.title: Our Board
team.presidentBio: John R. Monteiro is a seasoned entrepreneur with 40+ years of success in engineering, renewable energy, and business development.
team.obiDirectorBio: Obi leads ShieldForce Corporation, leveraging AI-driven cybersecurity to protect businesses from financial losses, and reputational harm.
team.dorisDirectorBio: Doris is a Rhode Island native with West African roots, is the founder of the Diversity Business Exhibit.
team.jengDirectorBio: Kodou leads WiSTEM Africa, harnessing inclusive technology and AI to drive gender equity, digital inclusion, and leadership development across Africa.
team.treasurerBio: Mr. Jackson leads the New England Chamber of Commerce, advancing U.S.-Africa trade and economic development through strategic partnerships, trade advisory, and diaspora-led investment initiatives.

achievements.subtitle: Building bridges between Africa and its global diaspora to foster economic development, investment, and collaboration.
achievements.countriesDesc: We have members from over 50 countries worldwide.
